text: Fad: Sortbrun øl der ligner en stout i farve, men overhovedet ikke har den samme viskositet. Fantastisk duft af balsamico eddike og en tand sødme. Surheden er lækker i en dejlig balanceret smagssammensætning. Dejlig dejlig øl.

750ml bottle $21.50.
Looks pretty black to me. Lots of tan foam. 
Wine like smell with dark pitted fruit, kinda woody and hints of Brett. Whiskey is subdued. 
Vinous taste from the fruit and Brett, notes of wood and to a lesser extent, Whiskey. 
Great mouthfeel and stoopid easy to drink considering the abv. Worth the bucks? In my opinion, yes.
14-05-17 // draft at Alus Celle, Riga. Dark bloodred beer, beige head. Insanely complex beer. Some caramel sweetness, brettanomyces, dark fred fruits, light acidic, some red wine, some wood. Great.

Pours a deep murky brown body with thin tan lacing. Aroma is super tart sour cherries, light tart earthy character and very faint sour whiskey flavor. Mouthfeel is mouth-puckering tart, notes of sour cherry, other dark sour fruits, cranberry, earthy character and faint vinegar. Great
Provsmak på MBCC 2017. Svart med ljusbrunt skum. Doft av brett. Syrlig och stallig smak av brett.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Copenhagen - Black pour with beige head. Aroma and tatse is sour dark fruity, malty, medium to light acidity, dark malt, medium tart sour and malty in the finish.

From tap. Pours pitch black with a small brown head. Aroma is fruity, wineous and light roasted. Toasted malty, caramelish and sourish fruity. Lingering dark malty, smooth roasted and sour fruity far finish.

Tap (Alus Celle, Riga)
Nice deep red. Vinegary aroma, but some nice woodiness. Tastes like something youd drizzle on a salad, sweet and vinegary. Had a goudanband earlier today, and this is so bad it makes me angry.
Dark brown, almost black with almost no head. Slightly sour aroma. Strong fruity sourness with some roasted bitterness on the background. Lasting sour aftertaste with some bitter notes.
Dark brown with no head. Aroma and flavour of sour red fruits. Some unripe strawberry. Fairly oily texture. Sharp and a bit dry too. Some darker, bitter notes in the finish l. Only a light funkiness.

Tap. Poured a clear reddish brown color that mostly lasted with very good lacing. Moderate to heavy sour yeast and dark wood aroma. Medium to full body with a tingly texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy funk fruit flavor with a medium to heavy sour alcohol finish of moderate to long duration. This is a solid beer.

Draft from Local Cantina in Clintonville: dark brown, red tint, light tan head. aroma of oak, berry, vanilla. tastes are cranberry, woody, tart, wine, dark malts, cherry, vinegar, whiskey, acidic, tobacco, wine. medium palate. fun sipper.
Duft ristet malt rød duft kirsebær frugt smag sur tør mørk malt kirsebær svag ristet malt
Tap @ Mig & Ølsnedkeren. Nice head with good duration. Color is red/brown. Aroma and taste are rich sour fruits, wood, lactose acid, malt and little hops. Nice vinous sour finish.

Bouteille de 375 ml achetée chez Beverage Warehouse (Winooski, VT) au coût de 15,05$. Arôme: Odeur de vinaigrette à la framboise. Apparence: La couleur est noire avec une très faible densité de bulle. Présence dun moyen col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de cerises et de framboises avec une pointe de vinaigre balsamique. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement vineuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Présence de framboises sûrettes en arrière goût. (Rating #7286)

On draught and bloody gorgeous.
Sour cherry coupled with brett and a slight alcohol hit. The flavours are tart initially. With wonderfully complex blend of fruit acetic acid and sweet roasted malts toward the end giving way to a beautiful oak character that lingers for ages.
Having been to the brewtap in Denver this time last year I hoped to have this beer but it took a trip to Dublin of all places to get a pour of it.
Bottle from 2015. Clear dark reddish brown. Vinaigrette, vanilla and cherry coke, apple, alcohol. Sour, apple, raspberry. Medium palate and a long, sour finish.

Bottle from a friend. Dark brown color, minimal white head. Sour taste with citrus, cherry, cola, acidic notes, balsamic vinegar, wood and a bit of vanilla. Sour finish with citrus, cherry, cola, balsamic vinegar, acidic notes, vanilla and a bit of wood. Very nice sour.

From tap; black with small brownish head; aroma is lactic sour, chocolate, cacao, some malty graininess; taste is medium to very sour, with dark malts reminding of dark chocolate and cookies, some fruitiness, finish is dry sour funky; mouthfeel is slightly creamy, refreshing thin with medium carbonation and thin body; maybe a little too sour

Draught at 20th Pizza Port Strong Ale Festival. Pours black with a medium, frothy tan head, short retention with light lacing. Aroma is acetic cherries and plums, light bready malt, earthy hops and oak with farmhouse Brettanomyces. Flavor is farmhouse Brettanomyces, earthy hops, bready malt, oak, acetic cherries and plums with a dry finish. Medium body and light carbonation.
Mini-snifter at HopCat. Pours dark brown with no head. Aroma of fruit. Very tart in a pleasant way.

UPDATED: NOV 20, 2016 Bottle at Himmeriget.
Dark brown colored with a small off-white head.
Fruity and light acidic aroma of red wine and cranberries with notes of caramel.
Fruity and light acidic flavor of cranberries and dried fruits.
Tart finish

375ml bottle, sent from yourilevesque (thanks a lot, Youri), pours a deep dark mahogany with a small beige head. Aroma brings out fresh raspberries upfront, followed by complex whiskey barrels, and tart dark fruits. Flavour is complex, with loads of raspberries and whiskey barrels upfront, with intensely puckering tartness and light acidity. Woody, tart and acidic finish. Excellent.

What a great balance Sour ale. Very well flavored from the whiskey barrels. Sour blends intimately with the brew. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sampled in line at Zwanze. Batch 3. Pours black, with a small tan ring. Black, tart cherries, brown sugar, vanilla, and lemon juice. Sweet and acerbic, and very sour. Medium body, sticky, acidic, and clingy. This is sour first and predominately, with some pretty good character and aromas.

Draft. Minimal brown head atop red wine/dark brown body. Aroma is moderately sweet, Brett/cherry, some wood, funk. Taste is moderately sweet, lacto/lemon, cherry, some wood. Sticky medium-full body, some acidity, minimal carbonation.
On tap at CBC. Poured a black color with brown edges and a small sized off white head. Wiskey, wood/oaky, tart fruits, brett, and sour cherry finish.

Pours dark with minimal tanned head 
Aromas of oak, bretta, burned caramel, raspberries, sour cherries 
Taste has very tart notes of raspberries, sour cherries, oak, wood, brown sugar

Pours black with a low tan head. Aromas of dark red berries, cherries, oak chips, roasted malt, roasted nuts, brown sugar, whisky. Taste is quite sour with sour red fruit notes and slight funky character. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with moderate carbonation.
Pours black with flat tan head. Aroma of red and black berries, cherries, oak barrels, bretta. Taste is rich woody tart with a mild sour finish. Light to medium bodied with average carbonation.

(Draught) clearish deep copper (almost espresso), fine tan bubbles. Nose of olive brine, caramel, cream, tart grape, lacto and touch of bourbon. Taste of tart grape, caramel, whiskey, wood, touch acetic. Delicious.

Spurs seem to overwhelm the pallet. But this is definitely balanced by the bourbon barrel. Adds a bit of domination to a sour with vanilla and barrel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Roast meets tart, Deep brown with an off-white head. Quite tart with a moderate malt body.

Notes: Source visit GABF week 14

(375ml bottle, Batch 23/MAY/2013) Pours an opaque black body with a small beige head. Aroma of wood, leather, whisky, vanilla, plum, and vinous. Flavor of plum, port, raisins, aged balsamic, wood, lemon, and brett.
Dark black pour with a thin tan head. Malty nose with a hint of booze. Really nice taste, massive chocolate and lightly charred malt. Lightly sour. Really nice whiskey and oaky finish.

Pours a dark ruby-brown with no head. A faint fruit aroma with small hints of whiskey. A strong fruit taste with a balanced tart flavor thats not overwhelming. A nice balanced aftertaste thats sweet and just the right amount of tart.
A: Deep dark brown with a off white head. N: Berries, vanilla, coconut T: Loads of berries, caramel O: Very nice!
Pours a dark reddish brown color with tanish colored head. Whiskey, tartness, funk, dark fruits, and some oak on the nose; follows onto the palate. Medium bodied. Finishes tart and dry with whiskey.

Aromas of straw, hay, brett, cherries. Dark reddish brown purple thin foam. Complex tastes brett led, tangy raspberries, cherries, red wine, slight oaky bourbon finish. Smooth palate tingly finish. Great beer!
Säuerlicher Antrunk, keine Malzigkeit, was die Farbe erwarten lässt. Spritzig, die Säure bleibt konstant und weich. Im Mittelteil dann immerhin leicht malzig, sehr trockener Nachhall. 8/11/11/11/9/11

Color dark wine red. Aroma is tart raspberries and chocolate. Taste is tart raspberries, dark chocolate, and hints of bourbon. Mouthfeel is moderate with lingering sour aftertaste. This is an amazing beer.

*13 oz bottle poured into wine glass

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Deep opaque black-brown, light tan head. Light vanilla, caramel, deep sour fruit. Hint of licorice Very sour, pretty minimal lingering sweetness through the finish. Medium heavy body. Very very acidic. Alcohol somewhat present. Very good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Ive probably wanted to try Nightmare on Brett more than I have any Crooked Stave beer Ive come across. Im sucker for weird beers. Nightmare on Brett definitely delivers the weird. Pour is extremely dark for a Sour - deep brown color. Aroma is built on odd and wonderful stuff. Dank whiskey-soaked wood, vinous fruit, sour cherry, and some barnyard yeast. Flavor carries those elements forward with special emphasis on the fruit, wood, and earth. Lots of tartness and funk on the palate. This is one nightmare Id happily return to.

Bottle.

A- Chlorine, pool water, sweat, shit, subtle cherry.

A- Dark mahogany color, dark liquid, beige head.

T- Brett, funky, tart, slightly sour, cherry.

P- Medium body, average texture, average carbonation, tart finish.

O- Lots of Brett and funk obviously not unbearable. Tart and cherry tones and the aroma is just something else.

Bottle in Gunnison.

Dark pour, rich sour red nose. Cherries, hints of the whiskey. Full thick mouthfeel, sweet-tart rather than bracingly sour. Its a good sour red, maybe even a very good one. But Im not particularly in the mood for such tonight, and Im happy to let my brother-in-law drink the majority of the bottle.

Bottled. A black beer with a brown head. The aroma has notes of straw, brettanomyces, and caramel. The flavor is acidic with notes of brettanomyces, caramel, and fruit, leading to a lightly tart finish.

Bottle, from a trade with wchesser -- thanks a ton! Very interesting dark sour beer that has as much flavor from the yeast as it does from the barrel aging. Notes of dark fruits, vanilla, and sour grapes. Lively carbonation and some great Brett sour flavor. Really excellent.

[1/30/16] Bottle sample at the Encomium bottle share, after RateBeer Best awards ceremony at Hyatt Vineyard Creek Hotel in Santa Rosa. Thanks everyone who shared bottles! Muddy brown. Sour, vanilla, whiskey, fruits.
At ratebeer awards bottle share. Pours dark brown with a modest tan head and a sourish chocolate aroma. There is a very sour brown malt flavor with a tart finish.
Huge amazing nose on this one. Barnyard funk, oak, tart cherries. Very tart and sour. Wood, big Brett, currants, cherry, earth, mild vanilla bean. Excellent sour !!!!
Deep red/brown pour with a pink head. Delicious sour. Oaky, cherry, tart and delicious.

Bottle. Looks like a stout, black in color, dark, with a tan head. The smell is chocolate covered berries, coffee, wood, fruit, interesting, tart, and whiskey. The taste is tart, sour really, berries, wood, and whiskey.

(Crooked Stave Nightmare on Brett) Bottle 375 ml from a trade with sunnfire, thanks! Served into a teku, ABV 9.666%
Very dark red brown colour on the body with a small light brown head sitting on top, with good density and retention, leaving a nice lacing around the glass as it collapses.
Vinous aroma with red grapes, wood, red wine, some berries.
Intense sour taste, with red wine, balsamico vinegar, grapes, blueberries, some sweet notes in between, wood, light funk character.
Medium thin body, soft carbonation, dry palate.
Excelent beer.

375ml bottle. Quasi black colour with small to average, thick, creamy, half-way lasting, moderately lacing, tan head. Fruity, vinous aroma, notes of dark red and blue berries, morello cherry, blue grapes, an oaky and tannic touch, mild hints of balsamico, widely disguised strawberry bubblegum hints of brett. Taste is moderately tart, dry, tangy, fruity, vinous, notes of dark berries, blue grapes, morello cherry, a touch of balsamico, raspberry vinegar, maybe a very cautious touch of vanilla and oak, but eventually no deformation by overly present vestiges of whiskey BA; slightly prickling carbonation. Almost neglectable hints of brett or better, fully integrated, supporting, in no way dominating hints of brett; so much a character of its own - it seems to be of no importance in what barrel it has been conditioned. Surely Ill have to get a glimpse of the BA and Grand Cru variations to prove this hypothesis.
375 mL bottle poured. Pours a red tinted black with a fading off white head. Thick body, syrupy almost. Sour cherry, light grape. Lingering sour. Excellent

375, capped. pours a very very dark ebony with no head or lace. Big dark balsamic and oak nose. Also shows apricots and molasses. Creamy medium flat body. Molasses apricots blackberries balsamic and oak on the mid palate. Long tart dry finish.

Bottle from Vinspecialisten, Aalborg. Almost balck with a fully gone head. Aroma is sweet, malty, cherries, wood and bretty. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate acidic. Dry and moderate acidic finish. 061115

On tap at Whats Brewing 2015
Dark, thin beige head. Smell of dark fruits, funk, berries, barnyard, toast and dark malts. Moderate sweet, alot of dark fruits and a kick of toast, vanilla, funk, oak, alot of interesting layers, moderate to medium sour. An excellent beer!

UPDATED: OCT 2, 2016 Bottle. Very dark cola colored pour - pretty much black. Small dense dark brown head that dissipates fairly quickly. Aroma is black cherry, tart, quite acetic. Sharp acetic sour taste. Puckering. Good, but a sipper due to its aggressiveness.
On tap at Whats Brewing 2015, Stavanger, Norway. Pours dark brown with small beige-brown head. Aroma of vinegar, acetone, chocolate. Taste very sour.

Bottle. Pours near black with a near white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has lots of tart red fruits with a hint of acid and notes of dark grains supporting. Flavor full of sour red fruits with a decent amount of acid and a hint of Brett, dark grains and whiskey supporting.

KRS 130515. Dark brown colour with a beige head. Aroma is sourness, roasted malt, coffee, licorice, plum, raisin, coffee. Flavour is sourness, roasted malt, licorice, plum , raisin, coffee, whiskey, chocolate, vinegar, vanilla. Complex and a very nice beer.

Pours brown black with a thin tight khaki head that fades to a thin creamy looking collar. Aroma has sour funky nose with leather rotten fruit hidden sweet wood leaking though. Taste is sour funky fruit leather slight balsamic vinegar little wood. Palate is medium extremely biting and dry. The nose is amazing, letting the whiskey barrels slip through ever do slightly. This reminds me of Deschutes Conflux No. 1- Collage, but add the intense sourness!

Tap. Opaque dark brown beer with a small white head. Aroma is sour with notes of caramel, red berries, vinous tones and citrus. Flavor is sour with notes of caramel, citrus, red berries and roasted malt. Well balanced.

Aroma: Sweet Molasses, Boozy, Tart Red Plum

Appearance: Dark Brown Hue, Passes Almost No Light, Off White Head Ring, Some Lacing

Taste: Tart Red Plum, Boozy, Tart Cherries

Mouthfeel: Decent Carbonation, Medium to Full Bodied, Semi Drying, Mildly Tart, Mildly Boozy
Bottle at home. Pours black, nose is funky, oak, toffee, taste is quite tart and fruity, dry finish.

Stoutish to the eye and moderately sour on the nose this balanced black bad boy is a dream come true. Bags of definition and individually here and sort of reminiscent of a delishably oxidised Rodenbach. Bit of light ruhbarb in there too. 
Crooked Stave? If you cant see how theyre world class then your craft beer understanding is of no worldly knowledge.

Bottle thanks to Travlr 
Pours hazy dark brown with a small beige head, good lacing. Aroma is tart dark cherries, vanilla and Woody. Flavors are wood, dark cherries, vanilla, tart and dry 
Very good sipper.

Draft at the brewery. Pours dark brown with a fizzy tan bead. Tastes like dried dark fruits, yeast, booze, earth, and tart raisins, very sour. Light body and low carbonation. Smells like booze, earth, raisins, yeast, and very tart fruit.

Bottle. Pours a pitch black with a small, tan head. Aroma has lots of tannins, oak, vanilla, roast, cherries, grapes. Taste is very sour with vinous oak and vanilla. Dry and complex. Carbonation is high and the body is very acidic.

Small bottle from the brewery. This is darker than expected. It could pass for a stout by appearance alone. Legs are dense on the glass and a small off-white head lingers. The nose is balanced and complex with rich vinous suggestions balanced with oak, brownies, vinaigrette, berries, and raisins. The mouthfeel is pretty big and slick. Man, this tastes delicious. The acidity is stronger than originally thought, but its clean and sharp in a very welcome way. The vinous character continues with harmonious whisky notes and fruity suggestions as well. This is a world class sour. Pleasantly deep, balanced and clean with a remarkable complexity.

375 mL bottle courtesy of adnielsen, shared at a tasting. Batch 2. Dark red, thin tan head. Aroma of dark cherries, pepper, brett, caramel. The taste is dark cherries, whiskey, wood. Thin-medium bodied.

Pours black with a beige head. Aroma of dark malts, vanilla, balsamic, subtle notes of dark sour berries and black currants. Taste has those same balsamic and fruity notes and is pretty good overall. interesting brew.
Poured a darker red color with an off white head. Aroma was of dark fruits and vinegar. Flavor similar, fairly tart, a bit one sided and lacking complexity.

Bottle. Pours black with a small brown head. Aromas of vinegar, oak, malt, tannic, red berries, dry dark chocolate, brett. Taste is vinegary, oak, brett, red tart berries, some dark malts, dry woody finish.
Tap at Crooked Stave. Dark black pour. Aroma is tart dark fruits. Taste follows, very tart, little boozy but really well balanced. Really good!
UPDATED: FEB 9, 2016 Ratebeer Odense Summer Gathering 2015. Dry and tart flavour. Seriouly funky!
Odense ratebeer summer gathering 2015. Pours hazy brown reddish. Aroma of sourn red currents, cinnamon, tart, Brett., berrys.
Bottle @ Odense Summer Gathering, 2015. Pours black with a bubbly head. Funky and tart. Vomit and caramel. Medium bodied. Tart fruity notes. . Wood.
backlog. bottle. deep, sour, balanced, small hint of bourbon. Really fantastic.

Bottle 375ml.
Pours dark brown with low beige head. Good lacing. Aroma is of vanilla, fruits, wild yeast. Taste is of acidity, fruits. Straight-forward. Palate: Full bodied. Light-medium carbonation. Overall: Not really complex or enjoyable. Not easily drinkable. Somewhat messy. Not a fan of dark sours.

Bottle. Dark brown with garnet color, tan and very thin foam. Aroma: brett, wet cherry, a little whiskey, wet hay, fruits, vinegar, caramel, homemade red wine, gooseberry. Taste: sour plums, cherries, gooseberries, redcurrants, homemade wine, tannins and something alcoholic. Great sour ale.

Bottle (375 ml). From kcherney, thanks! Split with the Québec crew.

Appearance: Dark brown with a small beige head and little lacing. 

Aroma: Red and dark fruits along chocolate, acidic notes, oak and mild spiciness. 

Taste: Quite acidic with dark fruits, chocolatey notes, light vinegar, oak, mild spiciness and raisins. 

Palate: Medium body. Medium carbonation. Oaky. Fruity and acetic finish. 

Overall: Too sour and not super complex, balanced or drinkable. Subpar from Crooked Stave and not an impressive dark sour.

Pours a dark brown with a thin beige rim that leaves nice lacing. Nose is of coffee, licorice, smoke, red fruits/wine. Some light ash in the back but nothing bad. Taste is moderately tart and vinous with chocolate, grapes and coffee flavors. Body is medium, carbonation too and I must say that the sourness level is just perfect for that kind of beer. Overall a nice sour "stout", one of the better ones Ive had so far in fact.

21/VI/15 - 37.5cl bottle @ ElMananas Massaman Curry Tasting - BB: n/a (2015-796)  Thanks to ElManana + 1 for sharing the bottle!
Clear dark brown beer, small aery off-white head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: artificial brett, tannins, red wine vinegar, fruity touch. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: lemony, vinegar, red fruits, very sour. Aftertaste: fruity, some tannins, vinegar sourness, bitter touch.

pours hazy dark brown, red hue, with a small light beige cap, minimal retention and lacing. spicy chocolate, minty cranberries, medium acidity - assertive and almost pungent, bretts and other bacteria, spices. light carbonation, medium body - oily; semi-sweet, tart and spicy finish. roasted and spicy chocolate paired with a nice red wine.

Bottle shared. Deep brown / black pour,ring of white foam. Aroma is meaty, light iodine, oak, soy. Taste is roasty, meaty, lots soy, umami. Palate is full bodied, a bit heavy, light-med carbonation. Meh.

Dark brown black colour, off-white head. Sour aroma, red fruits, light coffee, mainly sour. Sour flavour, brett, red fruits, sour cherries, citric acid, lemon, hint of wood and white wine. Finish vinegar, white wine, caramel and malts.(From 37.5cL bottle shared @ ElMananas Massaman Chili tasting, Gent)
Bottle at Massaman Tasting. Bottle brought by Martinus. Brett, red wine, oak, acid sour. Not my favourite Crooked Stave beer.
Bottle. Black with tan head. Aroma is funky, sharp,dark fruits, berries. Taste of funk, dried fruit, touch of licorice. Dry and tart
Pours a burgundy red with a no head to mention. Aroma is cherries, vinegar and barnyard. Taste is cherries, tart, slight acidic, slight cherry sweet.

Bottle split two ways. Light black pour with tiny lacings. Nose is acidic, tar, roast, lots of balsamico and some tart cherries. Taste is tart, light roasty, some light burn with vanilla and almonds. Tasty!

Bottle from Alus Celle, Riga. Dark brown, some beige head. Sour fruit aroma, cherries, hints of caramel. Quite sour in the mouth as well, sharp berries flavours, possibly some woody notes towards the finish. Mouthwatering, literally.

I had the pleasure of "Tart of Darkness" last week and this beer is similar - both are packed with so many flavours that they put huge grins on your face. Its very dark brown, initially with a tan head but thats gone after a minute or two. Body is light / medium and the carb is low but the tanginess gives a lively mouthfeel. Aroma has berries, sour fruit, and the malt content gives a hint of bread dipped in fruit punch, or a sherry trifle. Flavour is bursting with red and black fruit. That really is awesome.

Bottle. A dark brown beer with a dense, beige head of moderate size. The aroma is rather boozy, with roasted malts, some licorice, plums, raisins, coffee grit and chocolate. Sourish notes. The flavor is lighlty sour, but with the same lovely elements known from the aroma. More focus on the dark malts though. Vinegar hints. Its full bodied, lightly warming and pleasantly carbonated. Lasting finish. Rather lovely this one. close to wonderful. 150513

Bottle 375ml @ Geokkjer
Pours dark brown with a tan head. Aroma has notes of malt, red berries, yeast, brett, funk, citrus, chocolate, wood and vanilla. Taste is medium sweet, medium sour, and light bitter with a long woody, berry, sour, brett and fruity finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with a beige head. Aroma of funk, vanilla, red fruits, malt, oak and caramel. Flavor is sweet and sour with some funk, chocolate, vanilla and oak. Medium body, average carbonation.

Thanks to ma gurl for getting me hooked up with this bad boy. 
Pour murky dark brown, with a small, quickly disappearing off-white head.
Aroma has lots of sour cherries, sour green apples, ascorbic acid, some almost tannin like sourness, slight vanilla. This is quite interesting, since it got plenty of the "usual suspects" regarding sour ales, but with a nice sweeter touch from the barrel. Brett in this for sure... DUH!
The taste is pretty darn sour.. I mean, for me, pucking sour, with some grassy bitter notes to it as well. This has that "wooden plank" to as well. Medium bodied, with a fizzy/lively carbonation. 

I mean, pretty darn sour, with faint sweet notes coming through. Pretty tasty, and pretty sour.. oh boy.

Bottle, 9.666%. very dark brown with small beige head. Aroma is malt, yest, dark fruits, oak, wood, cherries, vinegar and baking yeast. Flavour is malt, light roasted malt, dark fruits, sour, oak, wood, vinegar, notes of cherries, little baking yeast, medium dry, little acid, lemon and tart.

Intensely sour, but beautifully counterpointed with delicious bourbon and vanilla notes that really round out the flavor. Rich body that wraps that juicy flavor in a velvety malt jacket.

Absolutely nonpareil.

Bottle thanks to Rainer. Pours a clear brown with small beige head that lasts leaving spotty lacing. The aroma is strong licorice, wood, funk. Medium mouth, nice tartness, dark fruit, wood, light booze, very nice.

Bottle at Ølbutikken. Pours a hazy dark brown wita small off-white head. Dry and sour with aromas of sour cherries and cask wood. Medium to full bodied. Medium to soft carbonation. Bitter and sour finish with raisin notes.

375ml bottle, deep red pour with an off white head. Aroma is big on sour cherry, with oily dark malts, lots of woodiness. Body is medium full, texture is tangy creamy. Carbonation soft, heavy sour tart finish.

Draft at Falling Rock. Pours a very dark brown color with a thin tan head. Light, whiskey aroma with some tart and berries lingering. Strong, sour taste with whiskey notes and cherries. Very complex. Amazing brew.

Bottle with thanks to Adnielsen! Pours dark opaque mahogany, small beige head, dissipates fairly quickly leaving some lacing. Aroma is roasty, Bretty, oak, fruity, cherries? Flavor is medium sour, roasty, oak, cherries. Some whiskey notes. Medium body. I like pretty much everything these guys put into Leopold barrels, and this is no exception.

Bottle at Au Trappiste, Bern, 11/2014 batch 3Dark brown color, almost black, oily. Very interesting aroma, dark chocolate, wine and sour elements. Good, but its too sour, the body is too thin, there is no notable malt, at least it has a light balsamic note.A bit pretentious, and its not a high achiever.

Juice with high ABV. Of course nice sourness of vine quite well ballanced with beer bitterness. Awesome experience. Oily mouthfeel
Loved it!

Classic treat! Lovely brett, berries dried fruits, raisins, ripe cherries, raspberries, lemon, nice whiskey accent, but would love even more, oaky, vinous, tarty. Light sweet with moderate sourness.
Enjoyable long sipping brew.

In tap, poured a black hue w/ minimal head. Moderate dark fruit aroma. Initial flavor is light sweet w/ a bold sour finish. Tastes are lemon, plum, and oak. Full bodied. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottled. Pours deep brown with a small tan head. Aroma of wood,vanilla, caramel, sour berries, whiskey and brett. Slightly sweet flavor that ends up dy and tart. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. An excellent Sour.

from Au Trappiste - almost black beer et pretty clear and with no head retention; woody aroma with notes of black cherries and licorice; very sour and quite full-bodied; assertive nd quite dry; long woody aftertaste of whisky, black cherries and with a lingering sourness

375ml bottle acquired via Reserve Membership. Assist via Mr. Nielsen. Thanks buddy. Pours a darker brownish ruby hue, a good hazy darker middle with ruby reddish twilight glow on the edges and bottom. Frothy offwhite head atop stays as a firmer frothy layer, not full but sufficient, a thicker ringer laces nicely. Aromas are potent sour and stone fruit, plum and dried dark fruit meet fleshy black cherry, firmer lactic sour jabs. Earth, a bit of toast and tannic whiskey barrel and oak sneaks in. Some vanillin, earth with more cherries, pomegranate, yogurt. A potent sour zing on the nose is quite appealing. Initial is medium bodied, a bit more full, an alluring dark and stone fruit appeal gives this plum, black cherry, and fleshy dark fruit. Touches of pomegranate, nectarine and some citric tartness flow into a bit of biscuit, earth, gentle sweetness. Rich luscious dark plum stays firm with some decent sourness, a bit of yogurt. More reeled in than some of their other darker sours but still sour, a potent dark and fleshy stone fruit life really makes this appealing. Touches of vanilla, tannic oak, yogurty sourness presses on. A bit of toast, dark fruit and pit. Some plum, faint raisin and tapering sourness. The barrel here is more tame, a touch of lingering vanilla and gentle spiciness creeps up at times especially through the body and again on the finish. Red grapes, a bit of graphite and earthiness on the nose crops up at times. Perhaps a bit flabby at times but the flavors are impressive, the sourness firm but a bit more tapered than some of the other Crooked Stave offerings. I dig this, a gentle yeastiness, faint toast and lactic twangy life tapers out. I keep coming back to that fleshy plum. Tasty. Potent nose, dark fruit, stone fruit and red wine grapes with great flavors, a touch flabby at times and lasting frothy lacing. Neat

On tap at Crooked Stave and at Falling Rock Taphouse, Denver. Very dark red in appearance, almost no head. Tremendously sour. Cant tell what type of barrel this might have been aged in. Highly recommended.

Bottle @ home shared by Joes. Opaque dark brown to black color (although I must admit I was sitting outside and didnt bother to go in to thoroughly check the color) with a medium sized light to medium brown colored head that leaves fair lacing. Aroma is lovely: moderately sour, black currant, red currant, dark fruits. Taste light to moderately sour, sour dark fruits, unripe berries, fruitpeel sour-bitter. Might be a bit sour at first but it is extremely balanced. Lovely beer, but I dont get any whiskey.
Pours dark black with thin tan head. Smell is chocolate, espresso and funk. Taste is sour cherry, yeast, chocolate and fruit. Medium body medium carb.

Bottle @ Fermentoren, Århus, shared by Mads, thanks! Pours a deep dark brown with a small offwhite head. Aroma of light sourness, wet wood, oak, brett, dark fruits, tart cherries, bourbon. Flavor is rather sour, dark fruit, cherries, brett, wood, oak, bourbon, light vanilla, light citrus. Thin to medium body, soft carbonation, acidic finish. Good stuff. 200215
Pouring at EBF 2014. Pours a deep cola brown with a thin beige head. Big wood, soft funk on the nose. Tart acid, big and bright. Lemony and somewhat acetic. Very citric, tart and funky. Lovely stuff.
Mahogany colored pour. Small tan head. Splotchy lacing. Funky aroma of dark fruit and wood with a good nose of whiskey. Very tart cherry taste. Plum and fig notes. Smooth and sour finish.

Bottle at Daves BA gathering. Pours out a muddy brownish color with a small off white head. Aroma is of some odd tartness, funk, oak, dried dark fruit, whiskey, caramel, light berries? Taste is complex, the funkiness and tartness do something interesting with the whiskey barrels, nice notes of wet wood, oak, light tart fruits, dried leaves and a touch of whiskey. Unique, and in a good way.

Bottle bought @ bierkompass.de Pours hazy black with a small mocha head that leaves lots of spotty trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is sour, malty, fruity and funky with roasted malts, burnt caramel, dark bread, butterscotch hard candy, lemon juice, grape must, moist soil, hay, leather, barnyard, cocoa powder, coffee beans, orange zest, lemon zest and hints of balsamic vinegar. Taste is very sour and slightly malty with roasted malts, burnt caramel, sourdough bread, lemon juice, lime juice, red wine vinegar, overripe pineapple, grapes, plums, sour cherries, moist wood, soil, hay, barnyard, kumquats and lemon zest. Mouthfeel is soft, slightly round, tart and medium bodied. Finish is sour with roasted malts, dark bread, caramel, lime juice, red wine vinegar, dark grapes, sour cherries, moist wood, soil, hay, barnyard, leather, kumquats and lemon zest. Sour stout is a hard thing to pull off. This is close but the taste gets to citric acid sour making this fairly hard to drink.

Bottle shared by Keith, pours purple black with small head. Notes of lactic funk, currants, berries, and vinous stuff. Dark sours arent my favorite but this is very well done. Medium bodied with a tart Berry finish.

1/7/15. 375mL bottle thanks to Carl! Nice amber pour, good khaki head, good lacing. Nice aroma, good sourness hitting my nose, plenty of wood, definite bourbon. Very sour flavor - loving it - wood, oak, bourbon very present but still a damn tasty brew. I dig it!

Excellent dark sour beer. Thanks Carl for the share. Dark brown-red color. The nose is slightly acidic and earthy with cherry and oaky vanilla. Taste was dark fruity but you can pick up notes of woodiness, vanilla, and some alcohol heat. Very nice.
From the shared bottle. Boozy nose with vinegar and tart cherry throughout. Oak in there. Nice.
Bottle. Delicious dark sour brew. The bourbon did not come through too strongly on this but I liked it all the same.

375 mL bottle (badass label) pours opaque brown with a small tan head. First thing I notice in the aroma is some acetic, vinegar, some oak and then some port sherry notes. A bit oxidized maybe? Tart flavor. Surprisingly full-bodied. Pretty mild as far as a sour goes, mostly dark vinegar. Its aight.

From my dear brother: Pours dark brown with a light beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, vinegar, brett, chocolate. Taste is sour and dark beer. Yeah. It is rather complex. Nice roast and chocolate. Smooth going down. Good stuff.

Bottle - Pours deep dark purple with a thin bubbly tan head. Nose is lightly fruity with red wine and a little oak. Taste is sour fruit, oak, cherry, and a lot of maltiness. Mellow body and well-carbonated.

bottle. black with a small tan head. tart red fruits, chocolate aroma. this one has cherry and sour fruits and chocolate flavors. moderate to high sourness intensity. not much whiskey barrel character. warming with the abv. moderately dry.

Pours a deep brownish black from the bottle with thin wisp of tan head that leaves moderate lace. Aroma of bourbon over sour funky brett fruitiness. Taste is sour dark fruits up front, middle is vanilla bourbon, warming boozy ending. Big cherry sour, tart finish, thin and well carbonated. Wow, first from them and it is delicious, a lot going on.

Bottle. Pours a deep chocolatey brown. Aroma is bitter chocolate, smoke, prunes, orange juice, roasted apple, preserved lemon. Taste is sour plums and fruity coffee fading into lemon juice, sour cherry, and oak. A bit light and sharp. Decent.

Aroma is rather acidic with lots of cherry, berry and cassis along with light citrus. Some light raisin and fig. Dark malt notes of toasted bread and toffee with hints of bourbon and oak. 
Pours dark brown with a small, fairly thick, tan head with nice retention as it recedes to the edges and lingers. 
Flavor is fairly tart with a lot of dark berry and cassis notes. Medium light bitterness with light oak and bourbon. Lots of dark fruit with lighter malt notes of toasted bread, dark toffee and caramel. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and medium low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, an alright beer but I am not a fan of the Nightmare on Brett series. Lots of dark fruit and acidity.

Brown pour with thin tan head.
very sour, dark fruit, lemon, balsamic, cherry, finishing with whiskey notes

only if you like things super sour cuz wow thats sour.

On tap @ Beachwood Brewing. Nearly black without much head or carbonation. Starts off with some nice whiskey and graham cracker. Maybe some vanilla. A bit of red wine, lots of balsamic vinegar, and chocolate. A ton of lemon juice, too. Flavor has a light char and roast note to it. Very, very, very sour. Mix of lemon juice and balsamic vinegar. Hints of chocolate and whiskey. Mild malt sweetness and molasses.

Tap at brewery. Pours a nice dark brown with khaki head. Aroma is slightly funky, oak, roast. A bit of must. Taste is nicely tart, fading to a nice roasted oakey taste. Hints of chocolate. Funky! Palate is medium body, medium carbonation. Lots of body, very complex.
Awesome sour on tap at Crooked Stave (source). Black color, off white head. Fruit, wood, and funk abounds!

On tap at the brewery. Black in color with a decent sized beige head. Aroma is of light roasted malts, wood, tart, prune, plum, cherries, whiskey, and funk. Taste is of plum, tart, cherry, vinous, funk, and wood.

On tap at The Source. Appearance: dark red to brown color, film of amber head, cloudy, no lacing. Aroma: oak, roast, light smoke, light grape. Palate: light body, soft carbonation, dry, sour. Taste: sweet malt right into tart fruitiness, finish is light bourbon and smokiness. Overall, tartness is amazingly subtle, so is bourbon taste, very nice balance.

Sample at The Source. Dark brown pour with some ruby around the edges. Medium light beige head that diminishes steadily, and partial rings of lacing on the glass. The aroma consists of oak, dark fruit and yeast. Medium to full body with flavors of dark fruit, earthy yeast and subtle whiskey. The finish is fruity with a black cherry and oak aftertaste. Solid beer all around.

Thanks to westmeister for sharing this one. Very smooth with a light sour profile. Deep rich fruit aroma. Lightly tart flavor. Lots of cherry and a gritty earthy texture. Subtle whiskey flavors and wood aromas. Light vanilla and oak flavors as well. Nicely complex.

Again thanks to wchesser for this one. Complexity runs amok here. The bourbon is barely noticeable only in some vanilla and wood, but not much from the booze perspective. There are dark cherries, funk, woody, cocoa, coke, roasted malts. All over the place but works.

A visit to the Source paid off with this monster hitting the draft lines. Poured into a large snifter. A deep brown pour with a significant head. Head gone quickly but lacing remained. Serious aroma of dark fruits, some cocoa nibs, serious tart and funk, earth, peat, and dirt. The taste was a knock-your-face-off punch on the head. Serious tart dark fruits, cocoa, light coffee, basement, earth, peat, soil, and beef jerky. (Yes kind of a spiced beef profile...call me crazy.) Medium body, little carb. Finish is mouth pucker sour. Very very good. Almost seemed like me tongue was burnt afterward. The yeast are at play.

Thanks to errl for sharing this bottle. Dark brown pour with a tan head. The aroma has some oak and dark fruit notes, as well as some chocolate and roasted malt. The flavor is similar. There is a strong oak and whiskey character as well as some chocolate, dark fruit and apple notes. I also get some brett, a light bit of funk and some light tartness. Medium to thick mouthfeel and media carbonation.

375ml bottle pours dark rich charred brown with light edges and small head. Nose is musty dark fruit, woody funk, cola, tart berry, meat. Taste is tart musty earthy basement wood, berry, dark tart cherry, dark fruit funk, cola, nuts. Finish is tart funky earthy berry, dry wood, subtle sweet spices, dark fruit.
Bottle. Dark clear brown color, almost flat. Aroma of herbal licorice, cocoa, espresso, milk. Taste is vinous port wine, wow!

375 ml bottle. Pours a dark brown, almost black colour with a small beige head. Aroma of strong red berries, blackcurrant juice and English toffee. Rich flavour of sour red berries, some toffee sweetness, tart wood, butter and herbs. Full bodied. Very rich. Whiskey barrels are quite subtle but noticeable, and seem to accompany the flavour nicely. Dry, vinous, slightly sweet finish. Great.

375 ml bottle (9.666% abv). 2013 vintage, batch #2.
Pours dark red color with a small head. Vinous, sweet fruity aroma, dark berries, cherry notes, some wood and faint brett. Sour fruity palate, dark berries, red currant, maybe faint whisky notes, woody, oily berry juicy notes. Sour dry berry dominant palate, short dry and mouth-drying finish..
3336

37,5 cl bottle (9,66%) @ tiong. Batch #2, year 2013
Aroma has vinegar, red wine and strong notes of blackcurrant juice. Perhaps some lactic tones too. Flavour is rather tart with blackcurrants, red wine and lactic tones. Rather aggressive. One sour currant juice, not my thing.


Oh, and could not locate the whisky here. All I can observe is the currant juice.

375ml bottle from Mikkeller & Friends
2013 / Batch 2, 9.66% ABV - Pours almost black with a tiny white head. Aroma of red wine, tart berries, sourness, whisky, wood, oak and cherries. Taste is heavy with tart berries, sourness, vinegar, whisky, wood, cherries and oak. Finish is heavy with blackcurrant, tart cherries, berries, wood, vinous and oaky notes. Quite heavy and sour with loads of blackcurrant, tart cherries and woody notes. Whisky notes are very subtle.

Dark wood, dark fruit and some whiskey aroma. Very dark and full flavored. Taste is a brilliant vinous sour prob 7 of 10, with nice dark fruit taste, oak and some whiskey and peppery notes from the rye. It is super complex and really a great beer!!! I almost get a bit of a coffee aroma out if it as well, but do not get that in the flavor. Great sour. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pour is dark brown with a hint of dark red on the edges and a small amount of light brown tan head. Nose has a hint of smoke, musky mossy brett, faint touch of cherry. Taste is strong, musky brett, more malt presence. A bit of dark chocolate, notes of smoked meat, lots of sour cherry and a bit sweet in the back. Creamy feel, grainy carbonation, slick finish.

375ml red wax bottle from onebigtymer11. Thanks Nick. Pours a dark cola brown color with a small khaki head. Aroma of sweet and tart black cherries, whiskey, and funk. Taste is much the same. Funky, sour black cherries, oak, and hints of whiskey. Solid
Bottle. Pours dark brown tan head. Nose and taste of whiskey, oak, sour dark cherry, caramel and sour dark fruit. Medium body.

375ml red wax bottle shared by Ed5388. Poured a cola looking deep dark brown with lots of clinging bubbles and a foamy beige head. Aroma is great, very sour, funky, some horse blanket, sour dark cherry, chocolate batter, dry dark toast. Body is medium, acidic, stronger carbonation. Flavor is the same as the aroma. Great beer.
Draft. Pours near black with a thin bubbly head. Tart fruity base, light fruityness, rhubarb and strawberry, with a nice fresh tart fruity finish. Good stuff.

Pours a dark reddish brown with a small but well retained head.

The aroma is huge on sour cherries, its rich, funky, and fruity with some light oakiness. 

The flavor is very tart with a lot of sour cherry, lightly sweet and lightly oaky with a dry finish. 
fun
Dark brown with a barely existent head. Sour Brett nose with earthy funk. Plums are present. This is amazingly sour with cherries and leather. A little harsh with the sour.

28th May 2014Tasting at Chez Bruce. Thanks to our Bruce once again. Hazy dark red - amber - brown beer. Small pale tan head. Palate is light and dry and crisp. Flemish red sourness, quite sharp. Little balsamic and a touch of dark fruits and lemon. Light dry finish. Not bad just a little spiky.

Bottle split at Bruces pad, big big thanks once again to our host, 28/05/14.
Dark mahogany brown with a moderate beige covering/spotting.
Nose carries dark pitted cherry tones, brett evident, dark toffee, light fruit balsams, funky, cherry skins, light smoke.
Taste comprises dark berry fruit medley, dark berry fruit balsamics, dark toffee, soured cherry tang, spices, brett.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Solid brett driven sour, wasnt getting much in the way of the BA mind!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Poured from bottle to snifter. Dark hue with off white head. Aroma is lactic, vanilla, caramel, oak, bourbon, wheat. Taste is dry tartness throughout with a slight woody astringentness in the following. Mouthfeel is great with a light body and great carbonation. Overall this is an absolutely fantastic sour!

Bottle shared in London - cheers to Bruce. Pours clear brown with a bubbly, dissipating tan head. Nice tangy, leather berries on the nose, wood, raspberry. Light to medium sweet flavor with assertive sour bite, nice funky twang, more leathery fruits. Medium bodied with fine, spritzy carbonation. Quenching sour berry finish, more leather, some brown bread sweetness. Lacks a bit of mouthfeel but solid overall.

Bottle, big thanks to Bruce,. It pours darkest brown with a small tan head. The nose is woody, vanilla, coconut, treacle, molasses, light funk and jammy berry. The taste is crisp, tart, cherry skin, lemon peel, Granny Smith apple, light jam, mild acidity, wood and sherbet with a dry, tart finish. Medium body and fine carbonation. Rather nice. Great mouth-pucker.

bottle near the end of the day ... dark chestnut .. . medium foam .. . a lotta brett, and dark bitter fruit .. . mild mouth and finish .. . decent overall 

.. . . a beaver without teeth, is just an otter....

Pours a dark cola color with a tan head that settles to a film and leaves good lacing. Aroma of dark cherry and some dark malt, along with light brown sugar and vinegar. Taste is sour with cherries and blackberries along with slight vanilla, tannic woody barrel character and some of the whiskey flavor. Finishes dry with lingering sourness. Mouthfeel is semi-slick with a medium body and high carbonation. More complex than other sours Ive tasted.

A muddy dark brown color with a smattering of khaki head on surface. Smells of sour, figs, vanilla, cinnamon, all spice, plum, funky barnyard, cola. Taste is a burst of sour with a vinegar taste, tart cherry, lime. The sourness dominates most of any other flavors that may be there. Smells are very interesting and doesn't represent the taste. As a sour it is interesting especially in the aroma but I would like to see more flavors come out of the sourness. Medium velvety slick mouthfeel low carbonation. Good overall. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Mahogany brown in color... Aroma of tobacco, oak, vanilla, chocolate, leather... Flavor is moderately acidic, lots of lemon tartness, hints of dark malts, chocolate... Tart finish... Amazingly good

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from The Davis Beer Shoppe. Pours dark brown with a very slight tan head that left rapidly. Aroma of musty sour cherries. Or some sort of rotty fruit. Med body. Flavor is quite sour. And it does seem to involve a lot of sour/tart "nasty" cherries. I have add ale thats more sour/tart, but this one is well balanced (whatever that might mean with this sort of ale). It is fabioso, delicious. Really well done.

Bottle. Pours opaque brown with thin off-white head. Smells of wood, dark fruit, and funk. Drinks with a sour bite and mild lingering bitterness. Medium bodied. Tastes of sour cherry, wood, and typical sour brown flavors. Finishes with lingering sour note.

Dark brown with an off-white head. Aroma is red wine, whiskey, sour funk, fig, hp sauce. Full bodied, funky on the palate with some fruity notes and a hint of umami. Taste is hp sauce, brett, dark fruits, funk.

Bottle shared at GTMW ticket line, pours a very dark brownish red with a thin off white head, the aroma is pretty cool, lots of dark fruit and bourbon with a kick of sour fruit at the same time, the flavor has a tart dark fruit front end with a dry finish, the sourness and the bourbon seem to work well together in this one, delicious.

Bottle shared at Mikkeller CPH. Reddish black pour. Big berry nose, light cherry tartness, chocolate, light roasty note. Juicy dark berries, sour cherry, dark chocolate and roasted cocoa-y malt. Berries in the finish, good Bretty tang. Really impressive.

Bottle (2013 Batch 2) at Mikkeller&Friends - shared with Mette. Deep dark fruits. Lovely bretty. Lots of dried fruits. Coconut. Bitterness. Cherries ? Bourbon. Alcoholic. Nutty. Light oxidation. Raisins. Plums. Lovely.

Draft at Proletariat with Linh. Pours a deep murky brown body with thin tan lacing. Aroma is super tart sour cherries, light tart earthy character and very faint sour whiskey flavor. Mouthfeel is mouth-puckering tart, notes of sour cherry, other dark sour fruits, cranberry, earthy character and faint vinegar. Great
Bottle. Pours a dark ruby black color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty bretty woody whiskey aroma. Fruity sour tart woody whiskey flavor. Has a fruity sour tart woody whiskey finish.

Bottle batch 2, 2013. Dark reddish brown with a medium sized diminishing tan head. Lots of whisky, wooden, plums, prunes, leather, lactic. Full body, medium sweet, heavy sour, oily texture, soft carbonation. Hides the alcohol well and it sure is sour, but the more I drink of it, the more I like it.

Bottle huge thanks to whomever sent this my way. Labeled 2013 Batch 2. Pour has a very dark cola brown color with little head and some foam on the glass. Aroma has dark sour malts, chocolate, tart cherry, and whiskey soaked wood. Mouth feel is average and the carbonation is on the low side. Flavor smacks with acidic sourness, tart cherry, dark fruit, oak, and a poke of whiskey.

375ml bottle in a tulip. Pours dark brown with a small, beige head. Aroma of sourness, some chocolate and dark malts, some whiskey and oak, dark fruits like grapes or cherries, and a slight funky note. Flavor the same with a nice blend of everything. Average texture. A really good beer.
Holy cow! Great stuff. Pours dark brown/redish. Vinous with chocolate notes. Lots of oak. Well balanced for a sour.

Bottle to glass. Pours a pitch black with deep brown highlights and a thin light brown head. Aroma is somewhat dry, light roasted malts, a very mild tartness. Flavor is bug! Lots of sour, ages fruits, cherries, not much in the way of dark. Medium in body with a lingering oily sour. Delish!

Rating #3600 - Pours quite dark brown with a reddish hue and a small beige head that leaves as quick as it comes. The aroma has dark berries, chocolate, bugginess, cream, black currants and smooth oakiness. The barrel seems to add nice traits, but not catching either the bourbon or boozy aspect at all. Medium / light body with with some light roughness and mild amount of sharp abrasive carbonation, Starts with a beautiful mix of tartness/berries mixed with smooth dark chocolate. There is lots of bugginess and graininess in there as well. Very dry and quite wine-like. In the finish there are light traces of whiskey, but very light. On the taste I dont notice any overt barrel qualities, but they are probably offering change Im not noticing. There is a touch of vanilla smoothness. This is an excellent sour ale that sure hides that higher alcohol in an amazing way.

Bottle. Dark mahogony beer with a tan head. Sour and light acetic aroma with dark fruit and light barrel characteristics. Sour and light acetic flavor with light lemon and light dark fruit. Medium bodied. Sourness and light acetic notes linger with light lemon and light oak.

Échantillonné du Extreme beer fest 2014: Un nez de stout rôti, chocolaté et un brin fruité qui ne laisse pas présager la délicieuse sauvagerie qui nous attend. En bouche cest assez riche avec les attraits dune bonne stout robuste mais soudainement les notes de brett cuiré et fruité se mêlent avec le bourbon vanillé. Chaque gorgée est surprenante et aussitôt léchantillon est sec. Elle me fait penser à la Anchorage Darkest Hour pour la portion bourbon, vraiment réussi.

375ml bottle. 2013 / Batch 2. Thanks Aaron! Pours a deep, cola brown color with a tan head and some lacing. Aroma is fruity, sour cherry, some oak. Medium in the palate with creamy carbonation. Flavor is light sour, tart, dark fruit, cherry, raisin, plum, oak, vanilla, maybe a little hint of whiskey, with a sweet and sour cherry finish. A really interesting beer. Wow. Definitely one of the best Ive had from CS.
Aroma is whiskey, oak, char, cherry, vinegar, sour. Appears black with barely a tan ring and spotty lacing for the head. Taste is sour lemon, cherry, whiskey. Medium bodied for style. Nice and sour.
375ml bottle thanks to pat. Pours a dark brown with a thin off white head. Funky cherry dark berry and oak aroma. Taste is the same with a bit of a bourbon finish.

Bottle. Pours brown with rapidly settling, off-white head. No lacing. Aroma is tart, acidic, whisky, oaky, slight roast and char. Flavor is moderate to strong tart, oaky, fruity, cherry, mildly vinous, with a pleasant whisky, oaky, fruity finish, very mild roast. Moderate carbonation, medium-light body, mildly dry finish.

On tap at Boulder Strong Ale Fest (2014). Pour is murky brown with a small tan head - decent lacing. Caramelly, roasty, dark fruity, slightly acetic, bourbon, cinnamon, and spice in the aroma. Taste is red wine, caramel, toffee, green apples, peach skin, light whisky, wood, and spice. Slick mouthfeel with soft carbonation. This is well-built and probably the best iteration of all the variations.

Tap at the Source. Pours Dark. Nose of cherries, and vinegar. Malty forward with sour and earth, gritty characteristics on the back end. Oak, with bits of vanilla, caramel, and chocolate balanced by a cutting sourness. Interesting. Cherries and whiskey mix extremely well.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar in San Francisco. Dark pour with minimal white head. Smells of toasty cereal malts. Quite tart and oaky. Somewhat acidic but pleasant mouthfeel. Some cherry notes.
2014-02-19

Dark brown pour with a thin light beige head. Nose is wonderful with caramelly earthy whiskey with a faint molasses and dark malt background. Flavor is tart and quite sour, but with a sturdy whiskey flavor featuring earthy caramel, sour oak, a touch of salty brineiness, dark chocolaty malt tones, a touch of roast, more smooth whiskey, more oak and char, and a sour wild yeast finish, dry and Bretty and tart. Outstanding.
Bottle. Black pour with beige head. Tart cherry, some Brett, and a touch of wood aromas. Vibrant sour fruit, some oak, Brett flavors.
Sour cherry nose. Black with tiny white lacing. Taste is wet sour cherries, wet wood, a big bundle of sweetens. Finishes sweety and sour.

This cherry sour has a port like feel in that its thick, sweet and sour but at just the right balance aged in whisky barrels, so whiskey and wood at just the right amounts. The malt is sweet, but not cloying and "smooth"/butter?. Roasted cherry aroma.

On tap at the Source. Dark brown with a lasting, light brown head and light lacing. The aroma is sour and tart with notes of dark fruits, bourbon, vanilla, oak and sweet malts. Similar flavor, tart and sweet with a smooth finish.

375 ml bottle poured a clear dark reddish brown with a lingering ring of tan foam. Aromas of roastiness, sour cherry, oak , light chocolate and a hint of whiskey. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a dry tart finish. Flavors of roastiness, sour cherry, oak and a hint of whiskey with a crisp dry lingering tart finish.

Pour out of 375 mL bottle, aged in Leopold Whiskey. Gusher out of the bottle, but admittedly didnt cool it down much. Dark brownish black pour with tan head, aroma brought notes of big sour cherry, berry, tart fruits into some caramel, oak, vanilla, some dark fruit, nice sour lemon, lacto type notes as well. Taste is a mix of sour fruit, dark cherry, hints of lemon into oak, slight funk, spice, vanilla, more tart berry, finishing fairly tart, slightly oaky, dry. This is well done.

UPDATED: DEC 26, 2014 Bottle. clear dark brown with a cherry read and a tan head that leaves quickly but laces. Aromas of tart fruit, black cherries, like chocolate and whiskey. Flavor is the same with some sour green apples. Medium bodied, acidic finish.

375 ml bottle shared by Roger - thanks again, Roger! Pours a clear amber-brown color with a small beige head. Aroma of vanilla, toast, brown sugar, lots of dark fruits (berries, plums in particular), soy, and chocolate. The flavor is much more tart than the nose lets on- tart and sweet berries, grape skins, crab apples, leather, oak, vanilla, chocolate. Acidity up front. Light-medium bodied, with medium carbonation and a tart, sweet mouthfeel. Interesting beer.

Tap. Pours black with tan head Smells light whiskey, vanilla, sour. Has a great sourness to it- a lot but nothing overbearing and definitely not too little. Touch of whiskey and vanilla. This beer is amazing, absolutely awesome!!!!!!!&
On tap at in denver at the source. Aroma is whiskey, rum, black cherries, plums. Flavor is tart cherries, fruits, and whiskey. A little boozy.
Great sour taste, super strong. Buttery notes along with the sour fruits, cranberry and green apples. Looks caramel brown and like it will taste amazing.

On tap @ the Source. Pours a purplish black appearance with a brown head. Funky black cherry, plum, whiskey, vanilla/oaky, sour aroma. Quite tart, plum, Welchs grape, a touch leathery, light whiskey flavor. Booze is held in check better than last year. Good.
